3:07 “I replay them nights, an right by my side all I see is a sea of that ride wit’ me
If they just knew what Scotty would do to jump off the stage and save him a child
The things I created became the most weighted, I gotta find balance an keep me inspired.”

Him referring to the Astroworld Tragedy and his grief is a unique, well written way to express an I’m all for it.  I’m admittedly not a big Travis fan but this album is by far his best in my opinion and this is the #1 song. 
Great work from Travis.

text: The first part of the song represents the nostalgic past, our childhood, the innocence and simplicity of our memories. This is exemplified by the simple fun lyrics like "rollie on my wrist" reminding us of the a time when things werent do serious and it was just about having fun, we were certain about the future, and world was a simple place. The transition to the second half the song takes us out of the past into the now where have to face the harsh reality. This is why Travis asks us to look at his eyes so we can see how much he has changed, things become more complex and nuanced we can see he's not the immature person he once used to be but he's gonna keep getting at it.

text:
Thoughts Attack Me 
 
[Intro] 
Ah! Yeah! Come on! Aha! Yea! Buss it! Buss it! 
You know… I love b…tching 
When I feel sad. Rich and 
Evil dudes try to diminish me. 
They can’t finish me. Snitching 
Fails. Justice prevails 
When my gun stops glitching. 
I love b…tching 
When sorrow irritates me. 
I go crazy. Hell awaits thee. 
Fires are ama-ama-amazing. 
Enemies burn in my crematorium. 
It’s a sad story and I get dic-dic-dictatorial. 
Revenge creeps under my corium. 
I speak Vic-vic-victorian when I pull the trigger. 
My shadow gets big-big-bigger in my crematorium-orium-orium… 
 
[Verse 1] 
Thoughts attack me exactly when demons try to whack me. 
Relatives don’t back me because they envy me. Frankly, 
I hate ‘em too. F…ck my shaky roots! They won’t make it. Boots 
Fall on ‘em. Laudanum is all they drink to think like a murderer. 
I order-order rum to drown my sorrow. Run away from 
The horror. Fun is a rare guest. I do my best to earn a dollar. Slum 
Is my home town. When I wanna glow crowds 
Laugh and get slow. Chow is cold now. Hungry like a mole. Out 
For weeks. Gnats bite my cheeks. I feel bad like creeps. 
Dragons fly. Deeds pile up like beats. Cops die on streets. 
But I don’t care. I wanna grow. Lairs make me vomit like a crow. Dare 
Speak the truth after chic booze. I live under snow. Mares 
I feed on help me grow. Bear a grudge against the dope mayor. 
I know-know the truth is out there. 
 
[Chorus] 
Thoughts in my head. Thoughts in my head. 
Demons gonna jump-jump. 
Memory’s dead. Memory’s dead. 
Sparrows drinking blood-blood. 
 
[Verse 2] 
Talking to the mirror. I ain’t a hero. They call me Loser, man! 
That’s why I get woozy. Pen is my sword I like to use again. 
A pussy’s phlegm makes me sick. That’s a crazy flick. 
P…rn is amazing sh…t. When I get lazy, a hit 
Dispels my wistfulness. I miss-miss fool pests. 
I never eat to the full. Jest to revive my mood. Yes. 
I burn a fool’s nest when I steal some cool eggs. 
If Hunger whispers, I do whatever it wants. Woo 
Pretty b…tches to get richer like Wu. 
Play and mix blues when chicks snooze. 
I give ‘em bricks. Lose myself in Eminem’s music. 
I crave for a happy end. My bang crew’s sick 
Like bachelor John Cusack. F…ck the society! 
Gonna be a star. Firing bazookas. Lucas inspires me 
To write stories fuelled by anxiety when bastards dehire me. 
I get high and dream of islands. Shooting vipers 
Is fun. Spooky spiders, go home! Leave me alone. 
Gonna make my groupie ride me. 
 
[Chorus] 
Thoughts in my head. Thoughts in my head. 
Demons gonna jump-jump. 
Memory’s dead. Memory’s dead. 
Sparrows drinking blood-blood. 
 
[Verse 3] 
My life is an endless alphabet. Idiots keep laughing at 
My f…ck-ups. Madhouse understaffing and 
Emptiness cause my laughter. At… large 
Like Burrows. My arrows keep attacking rats 
Who live in the jungle shacks. They die of hunger. Gnats 
Bite ‘em too. My crew can juggle bats. 
Dinosaurs in the tunnel. Max goes mad 
Because of getting fungal. Axe after axe. 
Their heads bangle. Cats chase Bob’s uncles. Vats 
Full of sharks and brats. Enjoy the jungle, lads! 
Swords punish foes. Ghosts vanish. Gross. 
I ain’t uppish. Show ain’t over. I’m a soldier. 
Gonna break your nose. Sorry for my sad story. Gore 
On my hands. Blast lorries. Law is toilet paper. 
Hatred’s victims galore. War after war. 
Virtual reality bothers me. You don’t cure mentality. 
So I dally-dally. D wanna placate me. They hate me. 
Brutality is a loco’s path. Tread on the broken glass. 
K…ll bogans. Dust and locals’ ash make me laugh 
Like Joker Slash. 
 
[Chorus] 
Thoughts in my head. Thoughts in my head. 
Demons gonna jump-jump. 
Memory’s dead. Memory’s dead. 
Sparrows drinking blood-blood. 
 
[Outro] Policeman: 
Good evening, mam! We’ve found a guy who claims to be a founder. Why 
Did you release ‘im? His reason is sick. He offered me a brick. 
Paramedics fixed his fried chick. 
Psychiatrists will help your son recover. 
He says that he is undercover. 
He chases demons who killed his lover. 
Is Rihanna your son’s wife? 
Is he playing with a big knife? 
Mam, I think your son is tripping. He should be sipping 
Some syrup in a madhouse. 
No. There is neither a mouse nor a louse. Mam, your son will forget such bouts. 
Please don’t worry! He will be treated in the best madhouse-house-house.

text:
Look in my eyes, tell me your tale
Do you see the road, the map to my soul?
Look, tell me the signs whenever the smoke clear out of my face
Am I picture-perfect or do I look fried?
All of that green and yellow, that drip from your eyes is tellin'
Tell you demise, I went to my side
To push back the ceilin' and push back the feelings, I had to decide
I replay them nights, and right by my side, all I see is a sea of people that ride wit' me
If they just knew what Scotty would do to jump off the stage and save him a child
The things I created became the most weighted, I gotta find balance and keep me inspired (Hah)
Yeah, yeah
That shit wild, instead I'm a hero
I took it from zero, LaFlame Usain
I run it for miles, this shit wasn't luck
They got me fucked up, I put you on bus and take you around
A couple of guys inside of the school, I gave 'em the tools to get it off ground
They say they the ones when they make the errors
Can't look in the mirror (That shit wild)
I stand on the stage, I give 'em the rage
No turnin' it down, can't tame it, can't follow it
We do in the streets, we do it for keeps
We do it for rights, got fifty-two weeks
This shit ain't for pleasure, I'm comin' to tweak
This shit is forever and infinity
Number eight, yeah, we write it and wrap it around
I take me a bean and I turn to a beast
Bought the crib on a hill, made it harder to reach
Bought a couple more whips 'cause I needed more speed
Bought a couple more watches, I needed more time
Didn't buy the condo, it was smarter to lease
And I bought some more ice 'cause I brought in the heat
Made a cast of my dick, so she never gon' cheat
If I gave you a day in my life or a day in my eyes, don't blink

text:
My eyes by Travis Scott is a genius song. 

It shows the weak vs the strong mind in the two parts. The weak sounds shaky and the pace is slow, it feels like the insecure side of travis. It also focuses a lot on materialistic things - “…Ten thousand on my eyes”. 

Then Sampha shows the mind evolving, gaining confidence with the clarity of voice, even more so with the beat picking up pace afterwards. 

Finally, the strong mind spits, talking fast and clear, and speaking on vulnerabilities. Weak travis talks about covering his eyes with his wealth while strong says “Look in my eyes” directly, essentially facing his deepest fears and/or demons. 

He talks about the events at the Astroworld festival and his break up(s). <- “Make a cast of my dick so she never gon cheat.” 

The “wait till the smoke clears out of my face” is proof of reliance on vices - he isn’t perfect = “am I picture perfect or do I look high?” Follows this and encapsulates this well.

I think the ending of the second part is just the cherry on the top though. 

The way Travis speaks on his material possessions, then intertwines it into the fast paced, hectic life that he is painting for us is brilliant: 

“Bought the crib on a hill” = “harder to reach” 
“Bought a couple more whips” = “needed more speed” 

More watches for more time and so on. It’s a fantastic way of not just linking aspects of his life and lifestyle, but also linking the two parts of the songs. 

And then the final bar: 

“If I gave you a day in my life of a day in my eyes, don’t blink.”… 🤌

All of this paired with the heavenly production easily makes this one of my favourite songs. 

Whether or not this was all the idea of Travis or my high ass reaching for the stars with this, tbh, I don’t give a shit. Just love the song. Good stuff 👍.
